item.title: RT Andrew Nguonly: Temperature, top P ‚Äî does anyone actually know what the optimal values are for these LLM parameters? I don't. So I built a @LangCh...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇAndrew Nguonly
Temperature, top P ‚Äî‚Ää does anyone actually know what the optimal values are for these LLM parameters?

I don't. So I built a @LangChainAI chat model abstraction (powered by @OLLAMA) to dynamically set them for me.

A short write-up: https://medium.com/@andrewnguonly/how-did-we-get-stuck-with-temperature-and-frequency-penalty-553c3e585544
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Benjamin ELKRIEFF: One of the major challenges when working with ChatGPT is its limitation in accessing real-time data. Check out Christian Braun's...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇBenjamin ELKRIEFF
One of the major challenges when working with ChatGPT is its limitation in accessing real-time data.

Check out Christian Braun's new repo that explains how to break the limitations of ChatGPT with @LangChainAI and @CometML üöÄ! https://bit.ly/3TJrP23

item.title: RT Mert Cakmak: Three teams have been dominating the LLM game for a while: @MistralAI for sota LLMs ü¶ô @LangChainAI for building with LLMs ü¶ú @tog...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇMert Cakmak
Three teams have been dominating the LLM game for a while:

@MistralAI for sota LLMs ü¶ô
@LangChainAI for building with LLMs ü¶ú @togethercompute for serving LLMs üöÄ

If you know how, you can build things really, really fast now.

Brief intro and code walk-through for you üëá

item.description:
üï∏Ô∏èCustomized LangChain <> @neo4j Integration

item.title: RT virat: Yesterday, LangChain released a neat "per-user" retrieval guide. For my financial assistant, I modified the guide's code to do "per-ticker" ...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇvirat
Yesterday, LangChain released a neat "per-user" retrieval guide.

For my financial assistant, I modified the guide's code to do "per-ticker" retrieval for financial analysis.

It worked really well.

In my code, I used:
- qa chain from @LangChainAI
- vector store from @pinecone‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1740073632305483869

item.title: üíøRAG on CPUs (with Intel Developer Cloud) Retrieval Augmented Generation is a great way to combine YOUR data with LLMs... which is why it's so nice...
item.description:
üíøRAG on CPUs (with Intel Developer Cloud)

Retrieval Augmented Generation is a great way to combine YOUR data with LLMs... which is why it's so nice to be able to do this with local models

This great goes over how to do that (with CPUs no less!)

Blog: https://towardsdatascience.com/retrieval-augmented-generation-rag-inference-engines-with-langchain-on-cpus-d5d55f398502

JeremyK üßë‚Äçüíªwalks thru building offline #RAG with @LangchainAI, #Zephyr & #DeciLM7b:

-Chunk and store docs locally
-Load models & DB offline
-Benchmark configurations
-Query with chains
-Zephyr accurate, DeciLM hallucinates

item.title: Building complex custom chains can be fun
item.description:
Building complex custom chains can be fun


Austin Vance:‚ÄÇHad an old RAG using @LangChainAI's older agents and Chain parent class. Migrated to LCEL and holy cow what a difference. Deleted tons of code. Steps are more clear. Parallel execution means the chain is blazing fast. Great work y'all such a fun one!
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Re @austinbv Glad to hear!
item.description: Re @austinbv Glad to hear!
item.author: LangChain
